ECE155: Engineering Design with Embedded Systems (Winter 2013)

Patrick Lam

Lecture notes

You may use these lecture notes however you like. I am placing no restrictions on their use. As far as I'm concerned, feel free to remix and share. I'll make the git repository available shortly.

  • Lecture 1: Introduction: about embedded systems; EGR example; design constraints and challenges; block diagram
  • Lecture 2: Sensors and Actuators; ADC and DAC; embedded control programs and operating systems. [slides]
  • Lecture 3: Java for C# programmers; logging.
  • Lecture 4: (v2) OO refresher; Event-Driven Programming; inner classes; callbacks; asynchronous vs synchronous execution. [slides]
  • Lecture 5: Behind Event-Driven Programming. [slides]
  • Lecture 6: XML, Inversion of Control, Runnable, Activity. [slides]
  • Lecture 7: Integrated Development Environments, particularly Eclipse. Introduction to Debugging. [slides]
  • Lecture 8: Debugging Strategy and Tactics. Assertions, single-step execution. Breakpoints. Debugging Embedded Systems. [slides]
  • Lecture 9: Simulation. [slides]
  • Lecture 10: Android: Intents. [no slides]
  • Lecture 11: Version control, notably Subversion. [slides]
  • Lecture 12: Software bricolage: creating software by integration. [slides]
  • Lecture 13: (v2) Lab 2 hints. Android: Toasts, Broadcast receivers, Lists.
  • Lecture 14: Engineering Design and Analysis. [slides]
  • Lecture 15: Engineering Design and Analysis II: Creativity, evaluation, design team organization. [slides]
  • Lecture 16: (v2) Testing. JUnit. JUnit for Android (sort of). [slides]
  • Lecture 17: Interval and Watchdog Timers, and their implementation in Android. [slides]
  • Lecture 18: Testing Android apps. General content on software testing. [slides]
  • Lecture 19: Guest lecture by Prof. Sebastian Fischmeister: real embedded systems. [slides]
  • Lecture 20: Catch-up on L15 and L18 material.
  • Lecture 21: Software Lifecycle Models. [slides]
  • Lecture 22: Lab 4; Android: XML, inflate, Graphics. [slides, programmatic ImageBitmap demo, ImageBitmap from XML demo, Shape demo]
  • Lecture 23: XP Activities. [see L21 slides]
  • Lecture 24: Comparing Software Lifecycle Models. [slides]
  • Lecture 25: Android: Persistent Storage via Shared Preferences and Files. [slides, file demo, shared prefs demo]
  • Lecture 26: Refactoring. [no slides]
  • Lecture 27: Refactoring II. [no slides]
  • Lecture 28: STS Case Study. [slides]
  • Lecture 29: Planning and Estimation. [slides]
  • Lecture 30: Code Review. [slides]
  • Lecture 31: Requirements. [no slides]
  • Lecture 32: Computational Decision Making. [slides]
  • Lecture 33: UML. [slides]
  • Lecture 34: Verification and Validation. [slides]
  • Lecture 35: Software Maintenance. [slides]
  • Lecture 36: Android: Multitouch. Course Summary. [Multitouch demo, slides]
